activities:
BBA U.S. Holdings, Inc. and its subsidiaries receive information from their sister BBA Aviation group companies located in the EU/EEA, including organization, customer and employee data.  

The data transferred from the EU/EEA to the US is used for the following non-exhaustive purposes: (i) business planning and workforce management, (ii) monitoring employee performance, management, professional development and succession planning, (iii) for the administration of employee payroll and benefits, (iv) building and managing external relationships and (v) knowledge management and sharing.

recoursemech: For complaints that cannot be resolved between BBA Aviation and the complainant, BBA Aviation has agreed to participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the panel established by the European data protection authorities (DPAs) to resolve disputes pursuant to the Safe Harbor Principles.
